Key Match Events: Luka Modrić scored a free-kick goal in the 51st minute, securing a 1-0 victory for Croatia against Poland in the Nations League match in Osijek.
Pre-Game Insights: Croatia captain Luka Modrić made his 180th appearance for the national team against Poland, while Andrej Kramarić was not in the starting eleven due to an illness.
Post-Match Reflections: Croatia continues their Nations League campaign in October against Scotland in Zagreb on October 12th and Poland away on October 15th.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Coach Zlatko Dalić made five changes from the starting line-up in Lisbon, giving the young Igor Matanović a chance from the first minute.
Others: The match was played in Osijek, and Croatia dominated the first half, taking 58% of possession and 10 shots on goal to Poland’s one.
